description:
Equipment rate per 100 households

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
63111 Continuous household budget surveys: general inf.
63211 Sample surveys of income and expenditure: gen. inf.

Definition:
The equipment rate is the statistical measure of how many
households own a specific good. For example, an equipment
rate of mobile phones of 90% means that 90 in 100 households
have at least one mobile phone. The equipment rate is
calculated as the number of households with the relevant
durable consumer good divided by the number of households
extrapolated and multiplied by 100.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2016
name: Equipment rate per 100 households
